search_input:
MEES The rose is a rose. And was always a rose. But the theory now goes That the apple's a rose, And the pear is, and so's The plum, I suppose. The dear only knows What will next prove a rose. You of course, are a rose - But were always a rose. The night has been ours Since we first watched a film It has always been so You now said there was a tension for a long time And I have to agree. Although I didn't dare to admit. And now I long for you in the night A warm, slightly bruised and tender feeling reminded her of the night before, the secret hours in Seans arms before Red had brought the children back. Though their time was limited, she had been well and thoroughly loved, and memories pulsed through her, touching off signal fires in hidden places. Last night had been a revelation. A dream. I know I said that I always choose the anticlimactic over the irrevocable, and yes of course what I meant was that I have always been a coward, but I lied: not always, there was that night, there was that one time.

*The night air was thick with the scent of blooming roses, and she could almost hear the soft hum of bees as they flitted from flower to flower. The memory of Sean's touch still lingered on her skin, a gentle reminder of the passion they had shared. As she stood there, lost in the haze of recollection, the city around her began to fade away, leaving only the two of them, suspended in time.*
suggested_query: The night air was thick with the scent of blooming roses, and she could almost hear the soft hum of bees as they flitted from flower to flower. The memory of Sean's touch still lingered on her skin, a gentle reminder of the passion they had shared. As she stood there, lost in the haze of recollection, the city around her began to fade away, leaving only the two of them, suspended in time.
